net.smacke.jaydio.buffer

Class JnaAlignedByteBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.smacke.jaydio.buffer.AbstractBuffer
      • net.smacke.jaydio.buffer.JnaAlignedByteBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Buffer, JnaBuffer

    public final class JnaAlignedByteBuffer
extends AbstractBuffer
implements JnaBuffer
    Implementation of Buffer which uses JNA to get access to properly aligned native memory, for use with the O_DIRECT flag.
    Author:
    smacke

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class net.smacke.jaydio.buffer.AbstractBuffer

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public static JnaAlignedByteBuffer allocate(DirectIoLib lib,
                            int capacity)
        Allocate capacity bytes of native memory for use as a buffer, and return a JnaAlignedByteBuffer which gives an interface to this memory. The memory is allocated with DirectIoLib#posix_memalign() to ensure that the buffer can be used with O_DIRECT. IT IS VERY IMPORTANT TO CALL close() ONCE FINISHED TO FREE MEMORY.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The requested number of bytes to allocate
        Returns:
        A new JnaMemAlignedBuffer of capacity bytes aligned in native memory.

                       int offset,
                       int length)

        Reads length bytes starting from offset offset into byte array dst from this buffer, starting at Buffer.position().

        length - The number of bytes to read

      • get

        public JnaAlignedByteBuffer get(byte[] dst)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads dst.length bytes from this buffer into the byte array dst. Increments this buffer's position by dst.length.

        Specified by:
        get in interface Buffer
        Parameters:
        dst - A byte array into which to read.
        Returns:
        This buffer
        See Also:
        ByteBuffer.get(byte[])

      • get

        public JnaAlignedByteBuffer get(ByteBuffer dst)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads min(this.remaining(),dst.remaining()) bytes from this buffer into dst. Note the subtle difference from ByteBuffer.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Buffer
        Parameters:
        dst - The buffer into which to read.
        Returns:
        This buffer
